main_definition: An alternative is another option or choice that can be considered when the usual, preferred, or expected one is not available, suitable, or satisfactory.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A different approach or method to achieve a goal
meanings_and_examples.example: Instead of using traditional chemicals for pest control, he chose an alternative organic solution.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An option that is used instead of the usual one
meanings_and_examples.example: After her car broke down, she had to rely on public transportation as an alternative means of commuting.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A different or second choice in case the first one fails or isn't available
meanings_and_examples.example: She considered taking a gap year after high school as an alternative if college plans didn't work out.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Another possibility that exists alongside other options
meanings_and_examples.example: When choosing a vacation destination, the couple saw both beach and mountain resorts as alternatives.
